content.description: Short juggy route on the far left side of the Portal.
content.location: Far left side of the Portal.

content.description: Scramble up the moss-covered bottom to a small ledge. Edge and smear your way up using more real slab technique than you're probably used to in the Red.
content.location: First route on the slab wall when coming from 8133

content.description: Bouldery start with weird crux at 2nd bolt
content.location: the slab in the middle of the arch

content.description: Looks can be deceiving and while this route may appear short and easy, it is quite pumpy. Begin with a high step and follow the line of the bolts that trend right. Avoid climbing into the choss up and left by staying closer to the bolt line.  A final hard pull off a left hand sidepull at the last bolt requires a little oomph right when the pump is really kicking in.  Despite only a moderate amount of vertical gain, the amount of traversing and overhang really add to the distance covered on this route.
content.protection: 6 bolt + chains.  Fixed cleaning chain draw at third bolt
content.location: 2nd route from the left.  Left of the main arch and just right of the short 3bolt 5.9.

content.description: Lieback up a chossy flake and stand on the ledge below the slab. Venture up on sparse holds, making use of the arête and smearing feet.
content.location: Right side of slab wall, climbs the slab up the left side of the arête.

content.description: Mega steep line with a hard boulder problem start. Rest up after the boulder then attack 70 feet of steep powerful climbing lots of potential kneebars. Great pitch
content.location: Starts on the right arch of the Portal.  Starts just left of 8133.

content.description:
Begin on the back wall of the cave, working your way through some vert climbing before entering the steep.

Launch into the next section of steep climbing, and then do cool moves through the massive iron band plates in the roof.  Perform the final longer pulls to the chains.
content.location: Left fringe of the Portal cave. Starts on the green back wall and goes through the steepest part of the roof.

content.description: Excellent technical bouldering on micro edges, crimps, and pockets leads to a good shake on a mailbox slot below the roof. Gather your strength then blast into a thuggy boulder problem to tackle the roof (Crux). Easier climbing leads to the anchor. Ignore the bolt on the far right under the roof.
content.location: Far right side of The Portal. Climbs the blank face in front of the large beech tree.

content.description:
This route shares a start with

Tesseract

but heads sharply up and right. Climb on large holds to the last bolt where you can figure out how you want to get to the anchors which are directly to the right - it's tough to get over there!

This is the last route that Kipp Trummel publicly bolted at the Red - thanks for everything.
content.protection:
7 bolts to anchor.

The last bolt is a glue-in bolt with a permadraw on it - there is also a 5-piece mechanical bolt; use the glue-in.

You can back clean the first draw at the start of the climb to reduce rope drag, but it's not really necessary.
content.location: Shares a start with "Tesseract" but heads to the right.

content.description: Start up the same green bottom as its neighbor to the left, but climb the right slab. It might be graded easier, but be prepared to get creative on this one.
content.location: Second route from the left on the slab wall. Starts at the same mossy bottom slab as "Trouble Afoot"

content.description: Classic slab movement all the way with a committing move near the last bolt.

Crazy steep climbing on bigs holds on the right side of the arch.  Begin with a hard boulder problem right off the ground navigating through some sandy/dirty holds before a rest ledge below the third bolt.  Fight the pump and try to find a knee bars when possible and any other tricks to rest your forearms before the angle finally abates near the top.  While not as intimidating as its leftward neighbor Singularity, this is one of the steepest routes at the grade.
content.protection: 8 bolts + chains. Only need 1 draw down low, the rest are perma-draws
content.location: On the right side of the arch are two lines, this is the right route.
